= Location in Tunisia | pushpin_label_position = bottom | pushpin_map = Tunisia | footnotes = }} El Djem or El Jem ( Arabic: , ) is a town in Mahdia Governorate, Tunisia. Its population was 21,576 during the 2014 census. It is home to some of the most impressive Roman remains in Africa, particularly the world-famous "Amphitheater of El Jem".Annuario Pontificio 2013 (Libreria Editrice Vaticana, 2013, ), p. 992 == References == Category:Towns in Tunisia
title: El Djem
